titleproper.value:
Guide to the Coalition of Labor Union Women: Betsy Wade Files
                    <num>WAG.020</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Gloria J. Walters, 1982 and Hillel Arnold, 2008

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-03-29T20:26-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Coalition of Labor Union Women: Betsy Wade Files

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
Betsy Wade, a journalist who worked for many years for the 
                <emph render="italic">New York Times</emph>and a member of the Newspaper Guild of New York, Local 3, was a founding member of New York Trade Union Women and of the Coalition of Labor Union Women (CLUW). The collection consists of correspondence between Wade and other leaders of CLUW, as well as material concerning CLUW conferences and conventions. Administrative materials relating to the New York City Chapter of CLUW (formerly New York Trade Union Women), are also present in the collection, as are clippings and subject files documenting CLUW’s efforts on behalf of working women.

p.value:
Published citations should take the following form: 
                <lb/>
                <lb/>Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; 
                <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives 
                <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 
                <lb/>70 Washington Square South 
                <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
                    <item>Coalition of Labor Women. “About CLUW.” 11 August 2008. http://www.cluw.org/about.html.</item>
                    <item>Roth, Silke. Building Movement Bridges: The Coalition of Labor Union Women. Westport, CT: Praeger, 2003.</item>
                </list>

The collection consists of correspondence between Wade and other leaders of CLUW, including Marjorie Stern, Pat Strandt and Luella Hansberry, as well as material relating to CLUW conferences and conventions. Administrative materials relating to the New York City Chapter of CLUW, including by-laws, election materials, newsletters, reports, resolutions and statements are also present in the collection. Also included are clippings and subject files documenting CLUW’s efforts on behalf of working women, including material on the Equal Rights Amendment (1980), the Senatorial campaign of Bella Abzug (1976) and Mary Anne Krupsak’s campaign for Lieutenant Governor of New York (1974).

subject.value: Women in the labor movement |z United States.
Women labor union members |x Societies, etc.
Women labor union members |z New York (State) |z New York.
